results.title: Dinky Hocker
results.creator_credit: Tom Blank, Diane Asselin, Paul Asselin, Robert Guenette and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description: Portrays the plight of a girl who is addicted to food and whose mother is too busy to be concerned. In the face of her mother’s opposition to her attempts at dieting and with the friendship of a young man who shares her addiction, Dinky makes one last attempt to gain her mother’s attention. Based on the book “Dinky Hocker Shoots Smack” by M.E. Kerr.

results.title: Diggers
results.creator_credit: Frank Thring and Efftee Film Productions
results.brief_description: This was the first feature film of the Melbourne enterprise Efftee Films and was adapted for the screen by Pat Hanna from three sketches from his popular Diggers stage show, which featured two Australian cobbers serving in the AIF in France in 1918. The first episode presents the two friends in their attempts to steal rum from a British Army Store; the second episode shows them relaxing in a French cafe while a fellow digger romances with the waitress; the final episode finds the diggers in hospital feigning illness to escape active duty. Cast includes Pat Hanna and George Moon.

results.title: Diner (Special edition)
results.creator_credit: Barry Levinson, Jerry Weintraub and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Levinson’s autobiographical first feature is a rites-of-passage ensemble piece about a college student returning home to Baltimore for the Christmas holidays in 1959. He and his old group of male school buddies attempt to fend off the pending responsibilities of adulthood by hanging out at the local diner and talking about football, women, cars and music. A sharply scripted and detailed observation of teenage male bonding rituals in small town USA, “Diner” is imbued with an acute sense of longing for an innocent, carefree, pre-adult life. Starring: Kevin Bacon, Steve Guttenberg, Mickey Rourke, Ellen Barkin and Daniel Stern. “Diner” was the first part of Levinson’s Baltimore trilogy, followed by “Tin men” (1987) and “Avalon” (1990).

results.title: Dim Sum = A Little bit of heart
results.creator_credit: Wayne Wang, Danny Yung, Tom Sternberg and CIM Productions
results.brief_description: This film takes a quietly affectionate look at an expatriate community living in San Francisco’s Chinatown. Widowed Mrs Tam (Kim Chew) has been advised by a fortune teller that she will die before she is 62, and wishes to put her affairs in order before this time. This includes making one last visit back to China, as well as wishing her daughter Geraldine (Laureen Chew) to be settled and married. Jovial bartender Uncle Tam professes his affection for Mrs Tam, although he is secure in the knowledge that she will not marry him while she has the company of her daughter living at home. Meanwhile, Geraldine wrestles with her obligation to stay and care for her mother. In English and some Cantonese dialogue with English subtitles.

results.title: Pavlova
results.creator_credit: Micheline Charest, Pierre Morin and R.A. Weinberg
results.brief_description: Fifty years after her death, Anna Pavlova is still considered one of the greatest ballerinas of the 20th century. This film is a tribute to the great ballerina and recreates those works which have made her immortal such as “The Dying Swan”, “Californian Poppy”, “The Dragonfly”, “Coppelia”, and many more. Performed by members of L’Ecole Superieure de Danse du Quebec and leading ballet dancers. Rated: G

results.title: Pavarotti in China: the Luciano Pavarotti Concert from the Exhibition Hall Theatre Beijing
results.brief_description: This is a live recording for television of Pavarotti’s concert performance in Beijing on June 24th 1986. This world renowned Italian singer once again presents a magnificent performance to an enthusiastic and appreciative audience, mixing popular Italian songs along with excerpts from some of the best known operas. Pavarotti is superbly supported by the Orchestra and Chorus of the Municipal Opera of Genoa with Dante Ghersi as choir master and Emerson Buckley as the conductor. Sung in Italian.

results.title: Differences
results.creator_credit: John Wright, John Taylor and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Differences is a short drama examining the racial conflicts that can occur among children when an “outsider” appears in the midst of a dominant culture. Chris, a pre-adolescent, resents the visit of Emma, a Native girl, to his home. Pressured by his friends to ignore her, by his parents to accept her, and by his own awareness of Emma’s loneliness and unhappiness, Chris must decide where his loyalties lie.

results.title: Paul-Emile Borduas, (1905-1960)
results.creator_credit: Jacques Godbout and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A study of the career of Candian artist Paul-Emile Borduas, showing all his painting styles - his surrealism, his cubism, his automatism, as well as his early workd while he was still apprenticed to Ozias Leduc.

results.title: Patterns of Landscape: Fred Williams 1927-1982
results.creator_credit: Christina Wilcox, Wilcox, Lisa Noonan and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Fred Williams’ works have changed the way we look at Australian landscape. His paintings have broken down the convention of what Australian landscape art represented to its people, and more importantly what it projected about Australia to the world. This is a visually challenging and historical account of the life and times of the late Fred Williams.
